page.title: 07PONTYPOOL/DISTRICT HOSPITAL
page.content: We went to interview the{Deputy {Administrator}for{Pontypool Hospital. {Pontypool and District Hospital}was built in two stages. The first part was built in{1907}and the second part was built in{1927. It serves an area from{Cwmbran to {Blaenavon. The main function of the hospital is as{a long-term stay geriatric hospital but there is also a ward for use by local doctors. The hospital is run by the{Gwent {Health Authority. }It has an out-patients and minor casualty unit but this is only open 12 hours a day. The hospital does not admit children -they are sent to the{Royal Gwent {Hospital}in{Newport. The hospital has no resident doctors and there are no plans for rebuilding of the hospital.
